page.title: 07River walk.Hele to Longaller
page.content: An abattoir and tannery flanked the mediaeval 3-arched Hele bridge which has been reinforced, but disfigured by iron girders. Most of the fields around the river have been harvested recently and farmers have taken care to plough the outer 10 metres of field prior to burning off the stubble. Extensive recent repairs and clearing of the river to relieve flooding was evident here although the areas of leats, sluices and weirs were seen to remind us of the past importance of mills in the area, first for 'knapping' cloth and then for grinding corn. Our walk finished at one preserved in remarkable condition at Longaller Farm where we were welcomed by a large heron seated high in a tree above the weir.
